hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Ratio Reversion to 30-Day Mean
hypothesis_content.statement: When the ETH/BTC ratio (ETH price divided by BTC price) deviates by more than 6% from its 30-day moving average during NEUTRAL regimes, trading the ratio back toward the mean generates alpha over 7-10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: ETH/BTC ratio shows strong mean-reversion characteristics in neutral regimes as capital rotates between majors. Extreme deviations often represent temporary sentiment extremes rather than structural shifts.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC ratio > 6% above 30-day MA (short ETH, long BTC)
OR ETH/BTC ratio < 6% below 30-day MA (long ETH, short BTC)
Deviation occurs after at least 5 consecutive days of trending away from MA

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio returns to within 1.5% of 30-day MA
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Ratio moves another 4% away from MA

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Ratio continues trending away from mean >60% of the time after signal, indicating regime change or structural break.
